title: 112_hr3665
content: The "Wall Street Accountability through Sustainable Funding Act" requires the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to impose fees and assessments to recover the cost of appropriations to the Commission. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to include the imposition of fees on agreements, contracts, or transactions related to commodities to recover the costs of annual appropriations to the Commission by Congress. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to include fees on commodities transactions to cover annual appropriations. The Commission will determine mid-year adjustments to fees collected based on fiscal year projections. The Commodity Exchange Act is amended to include fees on commodities transactions to cover annual appropriations. Adjust fee rates for the fiscal year to ensure collected amounts equal costs described, effective on the 1st day of the fiscal year or 60 days after a regular appropriation. The Commission must publish fee rates in the Federal Register within 30 days of a regular appropriation for the fiscal year. It is not required to follow rule-making procedures under section 553 of title 5, and there is no judicial review of prescribed fee rates. The fee rates prescribed under this paragraph are not subject to judicial review. Payment of fees for cleared transactions and uncleared swaps reported to swap data repositories is outlined. Each party to an agreement, contract, or transaction exempt from registration under this Act must pay the fee determined to the derivatives clearing organization. For uncleared swaps reported to swap data repositories, each party involved must pay the transaction fee. Each party involved in uncleared swaps reported to the Commission must pay the transaction fee determined under paragraph (1) in a manner and within such time as deemed appropriate by the Commission. The Commission determines transaction fees for uncleared swaps, to be paid in a timely manner. Fees collected are deposited as offsetting collections and cannot be credited as general revenue. The Commission collects fees for uncleared swaps, deposited as offsetting collections in the Treasury. If no regular appropriation is enacted, the Commission continues collecting fees at the previous year's rate until a new appropriation is made.
